summary: This bill, the "Ending Taxpayer Support for Big Egg Producers Act," amends the Animal Health Protection Act regarding indemnification for poultry flocks affected by avian influenza. It introduces a definition of "covered entity," focusing on large egg producers with significant revenue and employees. To receive indemnity, covered entities must certify they will limit dividends and stock repurchases, with additional requirements for private equity-owned businesses and public companies.  The bill includes penalties for false certifications, including repayment and potential imprisonment.
